meanings.definition: Used to represent laughter or amusement.
meanings.sent2: She said something hilarious, and everyone responded with a big 'haha'.
meanings.sent3: Haha, the puppy chasing its tail is so cute!
meanings.sent4: The colorful clown made the children laugh with a big 'haha'.
meanings.sent5: The comedy show was filled with 'haha' moments that made the audience burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: A sound expressing amusement or derision.
meanings.sent1: The room echoed with the 'haha' of the audience.
meanings.sent2: His 'haha' was loud and contagious, spreading joy around.
meanings.sent3: The 'haha' of the villain in the movie sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent4: The 'haha' of the bully made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The child's innocent 'haha' brightened up the room.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to indicate amusement or laughter.
meanings.sent1: Haha! That was a good one!
meanings.sent2: When she saw the surprise, she couldn't help but exclaim 'haha'.
meanings.sent3: Haha, I can't believe you fell for that prank!
meanings.sent4: The 'haha' from the audience showed their enjoyment of the performance.
meanings.sent5: His infectious 'haha' made everyone in the room smile.
